title: The Global Regulatory Race
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Global Regulatory Race usable.

hook.text: Countries are competing to attract crypto companies with favorable regulation. The winners get jobs, tax revenue, and innovation.

buildup.text: The EU, UK, Singapore, Dubai, and Switzerland are all positioning as crypto-friendly jurisdictions with clear frameworks.

discovery.text: The US risks losing its lead. Regulatory ambiguity and aggressive enforcement have pushed companies and talent overseas.

twist.text: Too much competition could create a race to the bottom, where countries weaken consumer protections to attract business.

climax.text: The nations that get crypto regulation right â€” clear, fair, and protective â€” will lead the digital economy for decades.

punchline.text: Regulate wisely and innovation comes. Regulate poorly and it leaves.

quiz.question: What risk does regulatory competition between nations create?
options: A race to the bottom where consumer protections are weakened to attract business
